main_definition: Volt is a unit of electrical potential difference or electromotive force in the International System of Units (SI).

meanings_and_examples.definition: Electrical charge difference between two points, used to measure voltage.
meanings_and_examples.example: The battery provides a voltage of 12 volts.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A unit of electromotive force in the SI system. One volt is equal to one joule per coulomb.
meanings_and_examples.example: The power supply delivers an output of 9 volts.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In slang or informal language, 'volt' can be used as a verb meaning to attempt or put effort into something, similar to 'try'.
meanings_and_examples.example: He decided to volt and ask her out on a date.
